summary: okay so one thing I wanna mention because it’s been sitting in my head all day  we’ve got Uko’toa, then a firebird, and then a...
body:
okay so one thing I wanna mention because it’s been sitting in my head all day

we’ve got Uko’toa, then a firebird, and then a big worm thing with a lot of teeth

Xhorhasians got into Felderwin via something that Matt described to Caduceus as ‘large worm entity [….] many teeth’.

what if one of the three not-quite-gods has already been unlocked guys? and if not it, then perhaps one of it’s servants

tags: this meta probably makes no sense bc im not proofreading this im too emotional for that
please talk to me about my boy bc i love him
summary: i think one of the things i love most about caleb is that he could have easily been relegated to Edgy Sadboi #76 but he’s so...
body: i think one of the things i love most about caleb is that he could have easily been relegated to Edgy Sadboi #76 but he’s so much more, particularly when it comes to his relationships with his friends. though he communicates feelings in an unconventional way and has the emotional intelligence of a walnut, he’s profoundly sensitive and sentimental. he hates the parts of himself that are cold and manipulative, though he has to use them to survive. i love the way he very firmly veers away from the “cool brooding man with a dark past” archetype bc let’s face it, caleb is probably the least cool member of the mighty nein. trying to close yourself off from others isn’t badass, it’s lonely and scary. at his core caleb is a person who just… feels very deeply, and cares about everything around him. and i think that’s really refreshing

torchstelechos replied to your post:
                    oh i thought i was done crying but wait --                
    When?   ...
body:

when they were underwater at the second uk’atoa temple.

blog.name: lostsometime
blog.title: I Lost Some Time Once...
blog.description: It's always in the last place you look for it.

summary: i love that beau has finally gotten to a point where she is willing to admit how hard it is for her to admit she likes someone....
body:
i love that beau has finally gotten to a point where she is willing to admit how hard it is for her to admit she likes someone.

like, she straight-up tells jester that she didn’t need to lie about dairon, she just didn’t want to say “oh i care about my teacher and i’m worried”

and then with caleb? “we’re already, like, invested? in your happiness? I GUESS?” like she’s pushing herself so hard!! i’m so proud of her!!

and then with caleb? “we’re already, like, invested? in your happiness? I GUESS?” like she’s pushing herself so hard!! i’m so proud of her!!

summary: Liam says there's more to Bren than we know. I wonder if it was a nickname his school friends gave him. If the direct meaning is...
body: Liam says there’s more to Bren than we know. I wonder if it was a nickname his school friends gave him. If the direct meaning is Flame it certainly sounds exactly like a nickname kids would give to each other. Maybe his first name is Aldric.

tags: thank u liam for ruining my life why are u so good at this shit....
summary: Caleb’s reveal last night shook me to my core so it’s time for some name analysis (most info sourced from behindthename.com)...
body:
Caleb’s reveal last night shook me to my core so it’s time for some name analysis (most info sourced from behindthename.com)

Let’s start at the beginning: Bren Aldric Ermendrud (official spelling courtesy of critrolestats twitter)

Bren: lots of people have already pointed out that Bren (or Brenn) in German means fire, flame, or burning. Makes sense! Also a horrible self-fulfilling prophecy considering it’s probably his birth name. Bren is generally considered to be a derivative of the name Brendan (and its variations), coming from the old Welsh word for “prince.” So, for Bren, we have “fire” and “prince.” I don’t think Caleb was necessarily lying about/concealing his heritage and that he’s actually a prince (although how cool would that be), but this definitely lines up with his ties to the real power in Rexxentrum

Aldric: a germanic name. From the roots for “old” and “ruler/power.” I’ve also seen it as “wise ruler.”

Ermendrud: again, germanic, coming from the words for “whole/universal” and “strength.”

So we have Bren Aldric Ermendrud, darling of the empire, a powerful and volatile young wizard. Someone whose name means strength, control, and destruction.

Let’s move on to the Caleb of the Mighty Nein: Caleb Widogast

Caleb: generally considered to come from the Hebrew word for “dog,” which spawned a lot of fun werewolf theories early on in the campaign. Alternate etymology theories connect it to the Hebrew words for “whole/all of” and “heart.” The name is generally connected to ideas of faithfulness and loyalty. Straight from behindthename.com: “In the Old Testament this is the name of one of the twelve spies sent by Moses into Canaan. Of the Israelites who left Egypt with Moses, Caleb and Joshua were the only ones who lived to see the Promised Land.”

Widogast: from the words for “wood” and “stranger/guest.” According to nordicnames.de the root “vid” is “in names probably a kenning for man,” so we may be able to extrapolate a bit here and consider Widogast to roughly mean “[masculine] stranger/guest.” I personally prefer this interpretation, my main reason being that “wood” doesn’t necessarily fit into the rest of the meaning of his name. There are also the obvious auditory connections to “widow” and “ghast/ghost,” of which widow comes from words meaning “bereft/void” and “ghast/ghost” comes from either “inspiring fear” or “frightened.” Both of these words have connotations of loss and grief. The literal meaning of the Old English gast is “breath; good or bad spirit, angel, demon; person, man, human being” (from etymonline.com) and is also used biblically to mean “soul/spirit.”

Here we have Caleb Widogast: A man who has lost everything. A stranger, unknown to himself and others, running scared, but one who eventually becomes fiercely loyal to his friends and is willing to sacrifice himself and go it alone to protect them.

Just from the names alone we can see how vastly different Caleb is from Bren. He’s gone from confident, powerful Empire mage to a stranger in his own body, but a loyal friend (who, in my opinion, loves his friends with his whole heart). 

It’s so incredible to me just how much thought went into both of these names and I have to take my hat off to Liam for his absurd amount of dedication to meaning and symbolism.

Also, for what it’s worth, Phillip means “friend of horses.”

Here we have Caleb Widogast: A man who has lost everything. A stranger, unknown to himself and others, running scared, but one who eventually becomes fiercely loyal to his friends and is willing to sacrifice himself and go it alone to protect them.

Just from the names alone we can see how vastly different Caleb is from Bren. He’s gone from confident, powerful Empire mage to a stranger in his own body, but a loyal friend (who, in my opinion, loves his friends with his whole heart). 

It’s so incredible to me just how much thought went into both of these names and I have to take my hat off to Liam for his absurd amount of dedication to meaning and symbolism.

Also, for what it’s worth, Phillip means “friend of horses.”

summary: We got so much Nott and Caleb lore, but (off-brand for me) Laura was my favorite part of episode 49.  Once I can piece my...
body:
We got so much Nott and Caleb lore, but (off-brand for me) Laura was my favorite part of episode 49. 

Once I can piece my thoughts together I have so much I want to try to say about Jester and her morality. Her whole worldview is more and more fascinating the more we get to see the philosophy behind her care-free outer shell. Jester’s 18 Wisdom is emerging in some utterly unique ways, and I’m in awe of the character Laura has built.

summary: The Matter of Lot 19 - Chapter 1 - pagerunner - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
title: The Matter of Lot 19 - Chapter 1 - pagerunner - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 5/5
Fandom: Critical Role (Web Series)
Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
Characters: Keyleth (Critical Role), Sun Tree (Critical Role), various OCs
Additional Tags: Future Fic, Post-Series
Summary:

Keyleth returns to Whitestone after many, many years to see about a unique and precious clock that’s up for auction. But she’s not the only one intending to bid…and her competitors might not only be interested because of the clock’s connection to a certain legendary de Rolo. Future fic, set significantly after campaign 1.
